main.name: Marlo Osborne-Subasic
main.description: Some of my favourite things are computers and learning new skills.
main.bio: I like to make things. I went to school to learn programming so I could learn how to make more things. I'm most familiar with front-end and more visual projects, but I'm interested in anything that calls for coding.
main.contactmessage: Please get in touch with me!

resume.skillmessage: Here are some of the things I've learned in school and on my own.

education.description: I learned about all the fundamentals of programming and much more. Some of the languages/technologies I learned: Java, Javascript, C++, C#, Python, Swift, SQL, Unity, React, AWS, Git, and more. I particularly liked working together with classmates to solve difficult programming problems. I also got on the Dean's Honour Roll.

work.title: Deli Clerk
work.description: I learned a lot of good customer service skills, and how to cut an onion very reliably. I had to memorize all sorts of codes and regulations in a very short amount of time in order to do the work more efficiently, and I'm told I was quite good at it.

work.title: 3D artist
work.description: Worked with Blender to make custom 3D character models/scenes for my discerning clients, according to the criteria and feedback they gave me for their commission. Learned a lot about 3d graphics, and how to work directly with clients.

work.title: Warehouse Worker
work.description: Worked with others to complete all orders within a given day, even if that meant a few hours of overtime every night. Learned how to fill out all the relevant paperwork, and how to organize my time and plan a route for maximum efficieny, while remaining accurate.

testimonials.text: Put in more effort than I expected anyone to!
testimonials.user: Chris Newstead - on a project I did for him in school
